Column2:
The teams fight each other in tournament mode

- The battle consists of a few rounds: the first to attain two victories, wins the duel.
- A victory in each round is gained after capturing the air zone ╷.
Column3:
The teams fight each other in tournament mode

- The battle consists of a few rounds: the first to attain two victories, wins the duel.
- A victory in each round is gained after capturing the air zone ╷.

Column2:
The teams fight each other in tournament mode

- The battle consists of a few rounds: the first to attain two victories, wins the duel.
- A victory in each round is gained after capturing the air zone ╷.
Column3:
The teams fight each other in tournament mode

- The battle consists of a few rounds: the first to attain two victories, wins the duel.
- A victory in each round is gained after capturing the air zone ╷.

Column2:
The teams fight each other in tournament mode

- The battle consists of four rounds: single, double, group and an additional group round.
- Armament is activated by timer.
- The victory in a local battle is gained after capturing the air zone ╷.
- The victory in a round depends on the amount of captured zones ╷. The victory in the first round brings you 1000 points, then 2000 points in the second, 3000 points in the third, and 3000 points in the additional round.
- The fourth round is played if the teams have the same score in the third round final.
- The fourth round is randomly selected from the three modes (1x1 2x4 or 4x4).
Column3:
The teams fight each other in tournament mode

- The battle consists of four rounds: single, double, group and an additional group round.
- Armament is activated by timer.
- The victory in a local battle is gained after capturing the air zone ╷.
- The victory in a round depends on the amount of captured zones ╷. The victory in the first round brings you 1000 points, then 2000 points in the second, 3000 points in the third, and 3000 points in the additional round.
- The fourth round is played if the teams have the same score in the third round final.
- The fourth round is randomly selected from the three modes (1x1 2x4 or 4x4).

Column2:
During the autumn 1943, the USAAF command regularly missioned the B-17 for bombing German military objects without fighter escort. They anticipated that a tight formation of bombers could take care of itself.

However, on the 14th of October 1943, after losing 60 bombers in one sortie, they published an order prohibiting day flights of bombers without fighter escort.
Column3:
During the autumn 1943, the USAAF command regularly missioned the B-17 for bombing German military objects without fighter escort. They anticipated that a tight formation of bombers could take care of itself.

However, on the 14th of October 1943, after losing 60 bombers in one sortie, they published an order prohibiting day flights of bombers without fighter escort.

Column2:
The Normandie-Niemen French fighter squadron served at the Eastern Front in World War II. French pilots flew Soviet Yakovlev fighters and specialized in escorting bombers and attackers.

Challenge yourself as an escort fighter pilot, covering friendly IL-2 attackers on their way to raid German positions.
Column3:
The Normandie-Niemen French fighter squadron served at the Eastern Front in World War II. French pilots flew Soviet Yakovlev fighters and specialized in escorting bombers and attackers.

Challenge yourself as an escort fighter pilot, covering friendly IL-2 attackers on their way to raid German positions.

Column2: It's the end of April 1943. The German army has decided to destroy a small Soviet base near Novorossiysk, and now they are launching a massive attack. German dive bombers are circling over Soviet positions at Malaya Zemlya almost permanently.

The year is 1944. On the threshold of the Battle of the Bulge, the US are concerned about the increasing quantity of rocket aircraft in German hands. In order to put an end to this threat, an armada of B-17's is heading to bombing the airfields where the "swallows" are located.

Take part in the fight for one of these airfields.

The year is 1944. On the threshold of the Battle of the Bulge, the US are concerned about the increasing quantity of rocket aircraft in German hands. In order to put an end to this threat, an armada of B-17's is heading to bombing the airfields where the "swallows" are located.

Take part in the fight for one of these airfields.

Column2:
- Firing from primary weapons is disabled
- Spawn on the airfield or near the "Aerobatic cube" is possible
- Aerobatic exercise pathways (near spawn points A and B and the Aerobatic cube):
    banking and eight
    S-turns of different difficulty
    bank modulation (preparation for scissors)
    scissors (distinction from bank modulation — absence of intermediate gate, smaller lengthwise distance but bigger widthwise)
    barrel roll
    knife-edge pass (alternate roll at 90 degrees) to the right or to the left, or advanced barrel roll
    loaded roll
Column3:
- Firing from primary weapons is disabled

Column2: Summer 1942. The German army is rushing towards Stalingrad. One of the main goals of the Luftwaffe is to destroy the Stalingrad Tractor Factory, where production of Soviet tanks takes place.

Although having a huge amount of tanks concentrated at the location already, the German army is continuously bringing more reinforcements. Soviet command has discovered the location of a large formation of German forces.

Column2:
The main task in the event is the evacuation of a ZSU Gepard. The vehicle cannot move, so the only method of capture - is using your tow cable to drag it to your team capture zone.

- Capture and hold the disputed vehicle at your base.
- You can respawn with all ground vehicles in your lineup.
- If destroyed, the disputed vehicle will respawn in the central zone in 10 seconds.
- A team loses 500 points if one of its members is knocked out
- The longer the vehicle is located in your zone, the faster the opposing team will lose points.
- The towed vehicle is vulnerable and can be destroyed, but for the destruction of the vehicle the team will receive 2,000 points penalty.
Column3:
The main task in the event is the evacuation of a ZSU Gepard. The vehicle cannot move, so the only method of capture - is using your tow cable to drag it to your team capture zone.

- Capture and hold the disputed vehicle at your base.
- You can respawn with all ground vehicles in your lineup.
- If destroyed, the disputed vehicle will respawn in the central zone in 10 seconds.
- A team loses 500 points if one of its members is knocked out
- The longer the vehicle is located in your zone, the faster the opposing team will lose points.
- The towed vehicle is vulnerable and can be destroyed, but for the destruction of the vehicle the team will receive 2,000 points penalty.

Column2: On the 16th and 17th of May, 1943, the RAF bomber groups provided massive attacks over the industrial areas of the Ruhr. Take part in operation "Chastise", which can significantly weaken the enemy.
Column3: On the 16th and 17th of May, 1943, the RAF bomber groups provided massive attacks over the industrial areas of the Ruhr. Take part in operation "Chastise", which can significantly weaken the enemy.

Column2: On June 27, 1939, more than one hundred Japanese bombers delivered a sudden strike on the Mongolian base at Tamsak-Bulak. Soviet fighters take off to meet them in the air.
Column3: On June 27, 1939, more than one hundred Japanese bombers delivered a sudden strike on the Mongolian base at Tamsak-Bulak. Soviet fighters take off to meet them in the air.

Column2: In March 1942, Japanese forces launched an operation near the cities of Salamaua and Lae in New Guinea. One of the steps in this operation was the attack on the airfields belonging to the Allies.
Column3: In March 1942, Japanese forces launched an operation near the cities of Salamaua and Lae in New Guinea. One of the steps in this operation was the attack on the airfields belonging to the Allies.

Column2: At the beginning of summer, Soviet bombers tried to destroy several Japanese airfields, which would have allowed Soviet aviation to achieve air superiority. However, the Japanese, whose fighters were superior and pilots more experienced at the time, disrupted the plan.
Column3: At the beginning of summer, Soviet bombers tried to destroy several Japanese airfields, which would have allowed Soviet aviation to achieve air superiority. However, the Japanese, whose fighters were superior and pilots more experienced at the time, disrupted the plan.

Column2: After the Allied forces had landed in Sicily, the German command tried to conduct a massive bombing attack on the airfield where a great number of enemy aircraft had gathered.
Column3: After the Allied forces had landed in Sicily, the German command tried to conduct a massive bombing attack on the airfield where a great number of enemy aircraft had gathered.

Column2: In October of 1942, the El Alamein operation started, which is considered a decisive battle in the North African Theatre. During the battle, the British army defeated the North African Italo-German formation of Field-Marshal Rommel.
Column3: In October of 1942, the El Alamein operation started, which is considered a decisive battle in the North African Theatre. During the battle, the British army defeated the North African Italo-German formation of Field-Marshal Rommel.

Column2: Winter 1941. The German army is rushing towards Moscow. Raids of German bombers on Moscow and the nearby factories are happening all the time.
Column3: Winter 1941. The German army is rushing towards Moscow. Raids of German bombers on Moscow and the nearby factories are happening all the time.

Column2:
In [Banner] mode, players have to capture the flag and assault enemy positions while holding it.

- Grab the Banner!
- Assault the enemy position while holding it.

The flag can be intercepted by destroying the standard bearer.
You can burn up to 1/3 enemy points at a time.
Only the standard bearer can capture the enemy zone.
The zone captured by the enemy can be recaptured.
Column3:
In [Banner] mode, players have to capture the flag and assault enemy positions while holding it.

- Grab the Banner!
- Assault the enemy position while holding it.

The flag can be intercepted by destroying the standard bearer.
You can burn up to 1/3 enemy points at a time.
Only the standard bearer can capture the enemy zone.
The zone captured by the enemy can be recaptured.

Column2: [Capture the Flag] Advance to the Rhine
Column3: [Capture the Flag] Advance to the Rhine

Column2:
In [Capture the Flag] mode, players have to capture the enemy's Flag and bring it to their Flag.
If you destroy a player who carries the enemy flag, the Flag falls to the ground. If the flag is picked up by a teammate, they will continue to carry it. If the Flag is picked up by a player of the team whose Flag was stolen, the Flag returns to its original position.
Column3:
In [Capture the Flag] mode, players have to capture the enemy's Flag and bring it to their Flag.
If you destroy a player who carries the enemy flag, the Flag falls to the ground. If the flag is picked up by a teammate, they will continue to carry it. If the Flag is picked up by a player of the team whose Flag was stolen, the Flag returns to its original position.

Column2: In [Total Domination] mode, two teams fight for domination at two strategic points. None of the teams can afford to lose a battle at any of them. They need a complete victory!
Column3: In [Total Domination] mode, two teams fight for domination at two strategic points. None of the teams can afford to lose a battle at any of them. They need a complete victory!

Column2: In [Total Domination] mode, two teams fight for domination at two strategic points. None of the teams can afford to lose a battle at any of them. They need a complete victory!
Column3: In [Total Domination] mode, two teams fight for domination at two strategic points. None of the teams can afford to lose a battle at any of them. They need a complete victory!

Column2: In [Total Domination] mode, two teams fight for domination at two strategic points. None of the teams can afford to lose a battle at any of them. They need a complete victory!
Column3: In [Total Domination] mode, two teams fight for domination at two strategic points. None of the teams can afford to lose a battle at any of them. They need a complete victory!

Column2:
In [Capture the Flag] mode, players have to capture the enemy's Flag at the enemy point and bring it to the allied point. The location of both points is marked on the minimap.

If you destroy a player who carries the enemy Flag - the Flag falls to the ground. If the Flag is picked up by a teammate - they continue to carry it. If the Flag is picked up by a player of the team whose Flag was stolen - the Flag returns to its original position. If a player of any team delivers the Flag to their allied point - both Flags return to their initial places.
Column3:
In [Capture the Flag] mode, players have to capture the enemy's Flag at the enemy point and bring it to the allied point. The location of both points is marked on the minimap.

If you destroy a player who carries the enemy Flag - the Flag falls to the ground. If the Flag is picked up by a teammate - they continue to carry it. If the Flag is picked up by a player of the team whose Flag was stolen - the Flag returns to its original position. If a player of any team delivers the Flag to their allied point - both Flags return to their initial places.

Column2:
In [┚ Battle] mode, teams will initially have one strategic point that is not available for capture by the enemy team. In order to activate an enemy’s strategic point for capture, you must control both of the regular capture points (╸ and ╹).
Capturing an enemy strategic point will result in an instant victory.

Fleet objectives:
- Capture point ╸ and ╹ to activate the enemy strategic point
- Capture all active points on the map for an instant victory
Column3:

Capturing an enemy strategic point will result in an instant victory.

Fleet objectives:
- Capture point ╸ and ╹ to activate the enemy strategic point
- Capture all active points on the map for an instant victory

Column2: In 1946, Communist forces launched several major offensives against the troops of Nationalist China. U.S. President Truman signed an order for large-scale military support to the Kuomintang, while the USSR began providing assistance to Mao Zedong's government.

Column2: The air above Cape-Sommerset bay is unsettled - rival clans from the Air Pirates Republic decided to determine the master of the region of Soaring Rocks once and for all.
Column3: The air above Cape-Sommerset bay is unsettled - rival clans from the Air Pirates Republic decided to determine the master of the region of Soaring Rocks once and for all.

Column2:
In [DEF-Domination] mode, the area of hostilities is guarded by a defense system that accumulates charge and periodically inflicts an electromagnetic blow on all invaders.
The emitters are located underground and are ineffective for attacking targets along the applicate axis. Thus, the areas above the emitters are safe and are marked on the map as DEF-zones.
DEF-zones are not capable of preventing aircraft from being irradiated, so they are advised to keep their distance from the battlefield during an electromagnetic strike.
Column3:
In [DEF-Domination] mode, the area of hostilities is guarded by a defense system that accumulates charge and periodically inflicts an electromagnetic blow on all invaders.
The emitters are located underground and are ineffective for attacking targets along the applicate axis. Thus, the areas above the emitters are safe and are marked on the map as DEF-zones.
DEF-zones are not capable of preventing aircraft from being irradiated, so they are advised to keep their distance from the battlefield during an electromagnetic strike.

Column2:
Unlock new aircraft by shooting down enemies and supporting your teammates!
You can monitor your progress at the bottom of the screen - which aircraft are already open and what needs to be done to open the rest!
All open aircraft are available in battle!
Column3:
Unlock new aircraft by shooting down enemies and supporting your teammates!
You can monitor your progress at the bottom of the screen - which aircraft are already open and what needs to be done to open the rest!
All open aircraft are available in battle!

Column3:

Column2: In this mode, for every 11 aircraft shot down, you can randomly obtain one of the 8 types of personal mark decals in "Area 88". If you collect all the decals for shooting down 88 aircraft, which is equivalent to a $1.5 million penalty, you will receive "the flaming unicorn" decal, which is the personal mark of the main character, Makoto Kazama, and the special camouflage for the F-5E TIGER II fighter, as well as the title "Etranger".
Column3: In this mode, for every 11 aircraft shot down, you can randomly obtain one of the 8 types of personal mark decals in "Area 88". If you collect all the decals for shooting down 88 aircraft, which is equivalent to a $1.5 million penalty, you will receive "the flaming unicorn" decal, which is the personal mark of the main character, Makoto Kazama, and the special camouflage for the F-5E TIGER II fighter, as well as the title "Etranger".

Column2: Bullet Hell is a team deathmatch style mode that pits two aircraft teams against each other using guns only. No missiles allowed! You can rearm and refuel in a special zone marked on the mini-map. The first team to reach the required score will emerge victorious!
Column3: Bullet Hell is a team deathmatch style mode that pits two aircraft teams against each other using guns only. No missiles allowed! You can rearm and refuel in a special zone marked on the mini-map. The first team to reach the required score will emerge victorious!
